lead_paragraph: A proposal for a nine-team English Twenty20 competition starting in 2010 and worth up to $2.57 billion will be discussed by the England and Wales Cricket Board next week. The plan, designed to counter the successful Indian Premier League launched this year, has been drafted by the Marylebone Cricket Club chief executive, Keith Bradshaw, and the Surrey county cricket club chairman, David Stewart. The proposal calls for an annual 25-day competition in June, featuring leading overseas players, staged by county clubs at the nine test grounds.
